abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is considered highly
            satisfactory, likewise, for both the Bank, and the
            Borrower's performances, who compromised on a set of
            priority programs, at a level of budgetary protection that
            would be feasible, given the Government's pressing
            fiscal constraints. Key lessons suggest: 1) that counterpart
            ownership of reform programs becomes an effective tool for
            implementation, and rapid disbursement of funds, and, that
            the Bank's willingness to support a phased program of
            reforms, ensured both budgetary protection, and a continuing
            dialogue; 2) that an effective political communication is
            paramount to social reforms strategies, and should be
            accompanied by comprehensive public information campaigns,
            provided reforming governments properly expose their reform
            rationale, which may avoid delays in implementation; 3) that
            in addition, the rationale, and extent of the Bank's
            support should also be clarified early, since the problems
            that arose from lack of understanding of the adjustment
            lending, led to confusion on the use of disbursed funds,
            whereas participation would have better been, part of the
            Brazil Rescue Package, simply as an emergency liquidity
            assistance, rather than a "Social Protection"
            loan; and, 4) that given the country's difficult
            political climate, the choice for several single-tranche
            adjustment instrument, proved successful.
